intro: Curcuma rhabdota, commonly known as the narrow-leaf turmeric, is a member of the Zingiberaceae family. It is native to Southeast Asia, particularly found in countries like Indonesia and Thailand. The plant is characterized by its slender, elongated rhizomes that are often used in traditional medicine. Its leaves are lance-shaped and can grow up to several feet in length, while the flowers are typically yellow or orange. The botanical features of Curcuma rhabdota make it valuable for both ornamental and medicinal purposes.
